S.FORM: pituwa tuki mukuwa ku i kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: takakesi lra, musavak na sinsi i takesiyan, marengay na pancang “katikedir! sungar!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: tamuni mi marengay da ”sinsi ’inavayan’’.
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: nu temakakesi mi mu, panadam na sinsi kaniyam kana tinarakasavakan na maiyuiyup na ngai.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

S.FORM: mitulus mi kana sinsi miyup, di semenay mi kana maiyuiyup na senay.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: sadu lra nangku kinasayhu kananta piningaiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

S.FORM: mukuwa ku i kungkuwan kana wariwari diya, menadanadam ku kananta piningaiyan kana wariwari, rarengay ku pakinger kani nani.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: i Kadaw ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是kadaw。
My name is kadaw.

S.FORM: i Asing tu ngadan ni malri.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad’s name is Asing.

S.FORM: i Ikay tu ngadan ni nani.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Ipay。
My mother’s name is Ikay.

S.FORM: mukecep ku ’ami harem.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: ulra ku iva na ma’inay a sasa, i Udalr tu ngadan, pulu’sa tu ’ami harem.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫kulas，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Udalr, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: mukasa mi temakesi kana kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: ingku di i valri na ma’inay mu, sahar mi semenay.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: sahar ku pakulima, nu kasede’an mu, mukasa mi saruma’enan mukuwa pakulimaya.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: sahar ku kirekadalram da vekalan na ’aliyan, karuwa mi mukasa semenay di pakulima.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: lralrak ku a pinuyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 我是卑南族的小孩。
I am an pinuyumayan child.

S.FORM: kaadu mi i Kasavakan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在建和。
Our family lives in Kasavakan.

S.FORM: lralruwac mi kaniyam i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatelu mi maruwadiyadi i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: ingku di i malri, i nani, i valri na ma’inay di i valri na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: tihasar i malri, kinsas i malri.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: valivaliw i nani, ising i nani.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: nu kadu i ruma’ i malri temarakasavakan kaniyan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Pinuyumayan language with us at home.

S.FORM: nu kasede’an na derun mu, adi aadi mi muruma’ i dekalr.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: marelrang ku kana valri ’emvang da kakiyas.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: sahar ku kananiyam cau i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: marelrang ku kani nani mukuwa kivangavanga kanini na wari.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: nu ’uninan i rukup salaw cangiya, adi aretid di adi vi’as na wari.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: kemayan mi i dadare’ mekan da ampang, mukadaw naniyam dadek, salaw sadeku.
S.TRANSL: 我們坐在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: piya kare’alri, demangdalang lra na lukup.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kani nani, man dangdalang na lukup?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: marengay i nani, lramu papana lra na variw kema.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: nu ’aremeng uniyan da lunev i lukup, mupacalan na vitu’en.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: uraruma’ mi lra.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: muraruma’ mi i dadalan mu, kianun ku kana vitu’en.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: amana mupana na variw, maranger ku diya mupacalan kivangavanga.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: nangku kungkuwan kadu kaniyam ruma’ i ngidiran, kana wariwari diya kemakawang ku mukuwa i kungkuwan, di kemakawang ku muruma’.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: adi ma’idang naniyam kungkuwan, adi kaduwan na temakakesi, marekadalram mi papiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: na lralrak muduwaduk i lalinayan, mukasa malimali, mukasa madayadayar.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: na sinsi mukasa kaniyam kivangavang, i kungkuwan mau na ma’idang na saruma’enan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: maidaidap mi kana wariwari, niyam aidapay paka’iceras i takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: ulra na mukuwa micura da lataw, ulra na mukuwa midappa.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: madalram mi da midap kana makapuyungan i kungkuwan. karekikakarun mi papiya, ’iceras i kungkuwan kana wariwari diya.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: adaman, mukuwa ku mudadangiya kani mulri na ma’inay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: sawariyan mi lra adi marepana’u, sare’ed ku kantaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: mena’u i mulri kaningku, payas pakan kaningku da taramunah, di pa’au da ociya kaningku.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，馬上請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: tavu’ tu sinaleman na taramunah i mulri na ma’inay, di tatena’ da imaran.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: sahar ku kantu ociya ni mulri na ma’inay, di imaran nu ’emau ta.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，喝起來也不錯。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: nu kare’alriyan, marelrang ku kani mulri na vavayan demeru da kare’a’alriyan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: kasaduwan tu tinusiyawan ni mulri na vavayan, ulra a vulraw, ulra a vuyu, ulra a siyak di dindin diya.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: piya mi lra kare’alri mu, mukuwa mi i sayhe kikulanga.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: i mulri na vavayan melak da sadu vurasi, vu’ir di lakiw, veray kaningku, paadayan muruma’.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: mukuwa ku sumungara kanadu, marengaya da daduwa ku diya mena’uwa kanadu nu kadaidan lra.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再來看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: harem kana wari tu pilralrangaw mi na sinsi mukuwa i tong-u-yuēn, mutulik mi i salikid cimima’ da kimpu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: musavak mi i tong-u-yuēn mu, marengay na sinsi, i nganguwayan mu, mau na ’aya’ayam, i likudan mu, mau na unaunan, kalrawayu kanmu mena’uwa mu papiya.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: makaud ku da unan, semalra adi ku yana’u da unaunan.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: mena’u ku da sadu a ’ayam, kadu i makaics kana kawi muviivii, di mena’u ku da alrupe’ na ’alrecu i makasavak kanantu vuwang na kawi.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: i savak kana tong-u-yuēn ulra na ma’idang na zo, uma di likulraw, adi ku diya mena’u kanani na haramhaman, salaw ku semangal harem kanangku ina’uwan.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，我非常開心今天所看見的。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: semasiyasing ku da sadu na siyasing, pana’u kana malri di nani.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: nu masalr lra mu, marelranga ku lra kana malri di nani duwa kani mena’uwa.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: kanini na kasede’an, marelran ku kani valri na vavayan mukuwa i valangaw mudadangiya kani ama na maralrak kani malri.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: kemay Tayhok muicas mi da kissiya mukuwa i Valangaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: meredek mi i Valangaw, i ama na maralrak kani malri midusiya duwa puicasa kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: adi adawilr na ēki kanantu ruma’ ni ama. nu midusiya ta dika meredek ta lra.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，若開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: kantu ’udar ni ama mu, ulra a ma’idang na puwarikanan, marelrang mi midinsiya mukuwa kanidu na puwarikanan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到那個牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: kadu i puwarikanan mu, tu adayaw mi i ama pakan kana takulris di tu puicasaw mi kana uma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊又讓我們騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: nu ’aremeng, marelrang mi mukuwa mekana i maci.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: alra sadu na dusiya i maci, semalra miotabay mi mukuwa kadu.
S.TRANSL: 因為市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: yavuruk mi mu, mena’u mi lra da kicakaw lra naniyam otobay. muicas mi lra kana bas muruma’.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: muruma’ mi lra i Tayhok harem di, nantu otobay ni ama mu, muacevung lra nay?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: makiteng ku diya kaadu mi i Valangaw, temakakesi ku lra mu, mukuwa mi kikaduwa i Tayhok, kadukadu mi lra i maci.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在台東，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Valangaw. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: temakesi ku lra i Daygak mu, temakesi ku kanantu cepa na Yuēncumin, madalram ku lra da ulra marekamelrimelri ta mauwan di ta kakuwayanan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: semalra, kanini na kasede’an na derun mu, ingku di i valri na ma’inay muruma’ mi i dekalr kiumaumalr kana dawdawan, maranger ku madalram data kakuwayanan inta.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: mulavat lra da makawalun tu ’ami ini na dawdawan, aymu, mena’u ta lralrak diya tu pinidadekan.
S.TRANSL: 這老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kantaw da sayhu marengay da eman ngaiyan? nu temarakasavakan salaw ’ilrepat, di sayhu diya tamarapayrang, tamaramingkok di temaradipung.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的建和語說得很流利，也會說閩南語、中國語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Kasavakan, as well as Hokkien, Chinese and Japanese.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku lra madalram ku lra, mau na makiteng diya mu, temakesi kana Dipung, di mituruma’an da payrang, di kanantu kiyakarunan marekadalram kana Rutiya, semalra sadu lra tu kinasayhuwan da piningaiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是閩南人，而他工作上認識了外省人，所以他所懂得語言好多。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Hokkien, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: madayadayar mi mu, sadu tu rinarengay na dawdawan kanantu ikadalraman da kakuwayanan a pa’a’alrupan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ara adiya mi karuwa madalram penauwa datu rinarengay, aymu, niyam pasirepay kana Soci, nu muruma’ mi lra maruwa mi diya temarakinger.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: makiteng ku diya adi ku kamadalraman data kakuwayanan. puremasamad ku kana mau ku na Yuēncumin.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，而對於自己是原住民感到有些不好意思自卑。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: marekasadu lra nangku kinadalraman mu, marekasadu lra ku kinapakumau data kirekamelriyan a pinuyumayan, di mau na pakamacas data anger awlra!
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為卑南族人，是很獨特的， 也是讓我們值得驕傲的吧！
The more I know, the more I feel that being a pinuyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: kanini na wari nu alusu kadaw, uraruma’ lra i wadi na ma’inay.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: marelrang ku kani mulri na vavayan mukuwa i iciba cimima’a da vuyu, padulu mi da keraraviyan pangara kani wadi na ma’inay.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，我們準備晚餐等待弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: makalrang mi kana menaniwan da kulakulang, kasaduwan na menaniwan kana ma’ama’at diya na kulang.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: cimima’ mi da takungkung, tavulaylay di ningzing.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: na menaniwan kana vuwa’ i ngidiran na tawki marengay, “nangku re’a di lupas salaw tavu’, kadika cima’ saeman” kema.
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: cimima’ mi da re’a di lupas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: makalrang mi kana menaniwan da tiwngan, marengay na tawki “cacima’ mu da eman? ulra a ma’idang di semver na vuyu harem, sasaya mu, telu leman.’’ kema.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼? 今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: padangal dadu kema i mulri na vavayan, kiumalr kana tawki karuwa diya kemadulu? kema.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: aymu, madulu lra kema na tawki, adi muwai lemehec.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: tu ’udar na tawki marengay, kadika cima’ kanangku vulraw, nangku vulraw ma’idang di madulu kema.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: likudan lra cimima’ mi lra da vuyu di vulraw, muruma’ mi demeru mi da matemuy a tu na siyaw.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: mangala mi sawariyan, ’aremeng lra na wari.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: padingwa pukuwani marengay i wadi pakunamun lra da adi karuwa semede’ i hitayan kema. nu masalr lra na kasede’an mu, karuwa ku lra muruma’ kema.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話過來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日我才能回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: sakuwani lra na dineruwan di uwa sa’ulu papiya mukasaya ta mekan nu kemadu. kema i mulri na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: sema’ul mi da wadadiyan, mukasa mi mekan kanani na imaran na keraraviyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: ulra ku lralrang temakesi i Capang, marayas malalup miinada da eman diya.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Capang，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Capang, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: nu takakesi ta mu, kivelas kana lralrang da impic, aicer, melri mu, mau na vavalrayan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: parasan, parepuwan, paretelun, tu pavelasay papiya kanintaw.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: aymu, kuwaceng nantu kakuwayanan, marayas kivelas da eman diya di, ma’ulid paveliyas.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: likudan lra adi lra maranger pavelas da eman diya kanintaw.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: ulra a saya wari, mukuwa mi kivangavanga papiya.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: kadu i dadalan, maranger muca’iya i Capang, malalup diya miinada da ciligami.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Capang想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Capang wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: kivavelas kana lralrang da ciligami mu, tumuvang papiya kantaw, adi ku miinada tu kuwayaw.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙的時候，大家都回他說，我沒有帶，這樣告訴他。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: macangis tu helran, ’ilremes marengay, man adi mu muwai pavelas kaningku da ciligami papiya?
S.TRANSL: Capang急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什你們大家都不借我衛生紙?
Capang burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tu tuvangaw na lralrang, alra adi u muwai minada, pawnung nu kivelas u diya mu, adi u pavaveliyas.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: adu kana ’emanan mukuwa i kungkuwan, semavalr meredek lra i Capang i kungkuwan. tu paveliyasaw kana lralrang kanantu kinivelas diya na eman diya.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Capang很早就到學校了，他把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Capang arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: sumungar kana lralrang i Capang, di marengay da yaada ku lra kanangku eman diya nu masalr lra kema. di sumungar diya kana lralrang da kinadaman diya na muwai pavelas kanintaw da eman diya.
S.TRANSL: Capang向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Capang apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: mau na pararawa i dekalr ni malri.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: makiteng ku diya mu, i malri di i ama na maralrak kani malri, nu ’aremeng mukakuwa i calun, miinada da tadaw di kuwang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上去野外，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: nu ’uninan lra mu, tu adayaw nantu rawa puruma’.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: nu eman mau na vavuy, nu eman mau na rava, nu eman mirawa da tuu’.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會獵到雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: tu karelrawalrawa’ay i salikid kana dekalr, pu’acar kana dinkalranan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: marayas ku makiwalray kani malri, maranger ku kurelrang mukuwa pa’alrupa.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: nu ma’idang ku lra tuy pilralrangaw ku lra mukuwa kema i malri.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說我長大了他會帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: na ma’inayan i dekalr sayhu penecir da rawa, sayhu demaway da putiru’an di cine’ece’an da varasa’ na pecir.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: sayhu demaway i malri kana putiru’an na pecir, marengay i malri mu, ini mau na ’a’evangen kana tuu’, ta tarena’uway tu dinapalran na rawa, na pecir mu ta ca’anay kanantu kakalrangan na dalan kema.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: kana ku marangeran pakunamun kurelrang kana ma’idangan mukuwa pa’alrupa, kana wariwari diya menadanadam ku demaway kana pecir. adi sawariyan nangku pecir tatena’ pateka lra rawa.
S.TRANSL: 為了想要趕快跟長輩一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: mena’u lra i malri mu, marengay kaningku, nu kadaidan lra kamau u na tatena’ na pararawa kema.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說，你將來一定會是一個真正的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: ma’idang ku lra harem, ku padekaw nangku kadalis di valru’, marelrang ku kani malri mukuwa pa’alrupa.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: muruma’ mi i dekalr mu, naniyam rawa niyam pu’acaranay kana dinkalranan.
S.TRANSL: 回到部落時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: marengay i malri, sasungar ta kanantu ipuvati da temuwamuwan, tu iveray kanta da rawa karuwa ta diya lremawa’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，給我們的獵物還能夠分享 。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: piwari ku lra mukuwa i kungkuwan a semavalr.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: mukuwa ku i kungkuwan mu, malalup ku miinada daku ’aliyuc.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: adi ku miinada da eman diya.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: temakakesi mi mu, marelrang ku kanangku lralrang mukasa mena’u da valray.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: semaseking mi mu, tu pavulasay ku da impic di aicur nangku lralrang.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: marengay na sinsi kaningku
S.TRANSL: kasemavalr marahan
nu masalr lra mu

S.FORM: i Amsing ku ’aliyan, alrak a Pinuyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Amsing，他也是卑南族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Amsing, and he is also an Pinuyumayan child.

S.FORM: mukasa mi temakesi kana dekalr i Kasavakan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Kasavakan部落讀書。
We study together in the Kasavakan tribe.

S.FORM: malayas mi mukasa kingkinger datu vinavati na dawdawan da vativatiyan, sayhuwan mi lra kinger da tinaraKasavakan na vativatiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會聽建和語故事了。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Kasavakan proficiently.

S.FORM: alusu ku di valivaliw ku, i Amsing mu, tihasar di marekedang.
S.TRANSL: 我很矮也很瘦，Amsing很高又很壯。
I am tall and overweight, while Amsing is short and thin.

S.FORM: i Amsing mu, salaw dalikedik di sidalu da cau, sahar na cau diya kantaw.
S.TRANSL: Amsing健康對人又非常熱心，大家都很喜歡他。
Amsing is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: undokay harem kana wari i kungkuwan, kasaduwan tu i parepakuwa i kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: ulra na makedekedeng kana cali, na cemapi’i kana mali, pavekas, malikasaw, di papana’an.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: ma’ari’ari ku pavekas.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: adu pavekas ku mu, kuretapelra’ ku, mudara’ pakirev ku tudu.
S.TRANSL: 當時我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: aymu, marahan ku diya, adi ku madiyadi mungaway pavekas.
S.TRANSL: 但我還站起來，不停向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: meredek ku lra i raredekan mu, semangal na cau mapiya.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ara adiya ku muelak kana sanga mu, salaw ku semangal, alra puludus ku lra kana ma’ari’ari.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: marelrang ku kani malri mukuwa mudadangiya kani temama Awi a adaman.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪Awi叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: mupanana tu kuwi ni temama Awi.
S.TRANSL: Awi叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: marengay kaniyam, tu sa’uv na ruma’ mu, ulra saya cavulang kema.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: tumulralre’ay kana sa’uv mu, mu’adulay di mutani lra kemay sawsa’uv.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂滑一跤就掉下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: miinada da tiwngan a hung di puran i malri vaveray kani tamama Awi.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔要給Awi叔叔的。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: kadu mi kanantu vinseng madayadayar, kasaduwan tu vinavati pakinger kaniyam da vativatiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在他的房間聊天，他說給我們聽了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: muvavuruk mi mu, marengay i temama Awi da tihasar u lra di vangsar u lra kema kaningku.
S.TRANSL: 我們正要離開時，叔叔對我說 你長高了又帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: tumuvang ku da ’’ lrayuwan! ama, nu ’inava lra nanu kuwi mu, kadika lra kaniyam mudadangiya mu! ’’ kema ku.
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: kana 2022’ami, na séhu paladuk da kayhiyan kana tu bibunsiyo na Yuéncumin karuwa putukasa puvalray da kangadanan.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kana vangsaran i dekalr i Lahay Ruvulreng, mau na pa’eceng lra kiami kana séhu da “putukasa da kangadanan” kananta bibunsiyo intaw.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了部落青年Lahay Ruvulreng他是長期向政府爭取我們的身分證能「單列族名」的人。
I interviewed Lahay Ruvulreng, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: marekuret mi kanini na kasede’an yawa ku kantaw kiumalra.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: kiumaumalr ku mu, tu umalray ku kanantu kangadanan na ipakalrangan di tu adayaw ku pana’u kanantu saruma’ean di kanantu dekalr.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kanintaw man nu asalraw nanu ngadan, adi ’inava na maluman na puvalray diyamaw?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: marengay kaningku, alra na tinararutiya na valray mu, adi maruwa penatedelr puvalray kanantu ngadan, di ulra na duma na cau “Lasinsen” kema mavina kanintaw, semalra malayas ki’apa’apa. kema.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \La Xian Sheng

S.FORM: marengay i Lahay Ruvulreng “na vinalrayan kananta valray na Yuéncumin mu, tatena’ mau nanta kangadanan. nangku ngadan pinucepa lra kananiyam mauwan, kananiyam pa’atayan, kananiyam inucauwan, ’inava nu kaduwan na cau tu acuvungaw nantu kangadanan. kema.
S.TRANSL: our family
Lahay Ruvulreng said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: adaman marelrang ku kani mulri na vavayan mukuwa i iciba meniwana, i mulri na vavayan miinada da sadu tu sinaleman na kulakulang meniwan, di demeru diya da paakan kana ukiyakesang.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去賣，也製作了原住民美食給客人吃。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: sahar papiya na cau kantu naniwanan, na kamangulr di na lrusi kaduwan na cemacima’, kaduwan na duwa patalrama kanantu tinusiyaw ni mulri na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和藤心很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and Cane palm, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: nantu dineru na pinuwayan kana mulingalingaw na kinavelas pukasa kana imaran, ulra diya na tiwngan a vavuy tinusiyaw kana lramumu, tu liwlran pukasa kana pasirep pukuwani da ukiyakesang, kaduwan na daduwa mutulik kananiyam naniwanan.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的放小莢豆的糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的圓葉胡椒湯，味道非常吸引了客人，很多人都會來我們攤位排隊。
The Lima Bean and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: nu demaderu i mulri na vavayan, kadu ku i ngidilan tematuwap kicacevuk ku kana ukiyakesang. tamuni ku marengay da “nahni na kulakulang mau naniyam sinaleman, adi mi pakiwalay pucemel. pakunamun kadika cimima’” kemaku.
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: naniyam emandiya adi repidan piya mi lra meniwan, marengay i mulri na vavayan “amau na ulra inu na pulraalrang” kema kaningku.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶對我說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: ini na semasahar, kipanadam ku lra datu sinaleman di tu kadalraman da akanen na Yéncumin, di pinatalram ku lra datu ulepan na menaniwan i naniwanan.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: mena’u ku lra kani mulri na vavayan kantu misaharan kana akanen a kinaawac pukasa asavak ku semangalan.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我深深感到特別高興。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
